intro: Lotononis azureoides, commonly known as the blue lotonon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
